model

Class FileHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.FileHandler

  • public class FileHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    The FileHandler class handles the reading and writing of RLE-files from and to disk. It also contains the metadata of a loaded file.

    • Method Detail

      • readGameBoardFromDisk

        public void readGameBoardFromDisk(java.io.File file)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Method to read a file from a disk. Calls the readGameBoard method, and catches several exceptions, giving a popup alert for many errors, explaining to the user what is wrong.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to be read from disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - Thrown if the file cannot be found etc.
        See Also:
        readGameBoard(Reader), PopUpAlerts.patternFormatAlert(), PopUpAlerts.outOfBounds(), PopUpAlerts.ruleAlert2()

      • readGameBoardFromURL

        public void readGameBoardFromURL(java.lang.String url)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Method to read a file from an URL. Calls the readGameBoard method, and catches several exceptions, giving a popup alert for many errors, explaining to the user what is wrong.
        Parameters:
        url - The url to the file to be read from disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - Thrown if the file cannot be found, or the url is invalid.
        See Also:
        readGameBoard(Reader), PopUpAlerts.patternFormatAlert(), PopUpAlerts.outOfBounds(), PopUpAlerts.ruleAlert2()

      • readGameBoard

        public void readGameBoard(java.io.Reader reader)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          PatternFormatException,
                          java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                          RulesFormatException
        Method that reads a pattern from a file. Goes through the file line for line and updates the metaData and metaTitle as well as sending a pattern to the Board. Heavy use of regular expressions to ensure that the file is formatted correctly, and that all necessary information is covered.
        Parameters:
        reader - the reader that will iterate through the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - Thrown if the file cannot be found, or the url is invalid.
        PatternFormatException - - Thrown if the formatting of the file is incorrect
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - - Thrown if the board is static, and the pattern exceeds its borders.
        RulesFormatException - - Thrown if the read rules are incorrectly formatted
        See Also:
        reviseRLEString(String), boardFromFile(String, int, int), formatMetadata(StringBuilder), GameOfLife.setRuleString(String), Board.getWidth(), Board.getHeight(), Board.setBoardFromRLE(byte[][])

      • resetMetaData

        public void resetMetaData()
        Method that resets the metadata and title.
        See Also:
        metaTitle, metaData

      • patternExportToString

        public java.lang.String patternExportToString(byte[][] pattern)
        A method to convert a 2D-array to a string according to RLE standards, but without the encoding of leading numbers before a character. Iterates through the 2D-array and appends the stringBuilder according to the cell state.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern to be converted into a string
        Returns:
        patternString.toString() - The string representation of the pattern.

      • stringToRLE

        public java.lang.String stringToRLE(java.lang.String rawString)
        A method that encodes a regular string to an RLE-string, changing repeating characters to a character with a leading number.
        Parameters:
        rawString - The string to be encoded
        Returns:
        RLEString.toString() - The encoded RLE-string

      • RLEtoDisk

        public void RLEtoDisk(java.io.File file,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      java.lang.String rules,
                      javafx.scene.control.TextField titleField,
                      javafx.scene.control.TextField authorField,
                      javafx.scene.control.CheckBox dateCheckBox,
                      javafx.scene.control.TextArea commentField,
                      java.lang.String splitString)
               throws java.io.IOException
        A method for writing an RLE file to disk using a PrintWriter. Takes all metadata and the RLE file and revise it to fit into the RLE standard, such as annotating metadata.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to be written to.
        x - The width of the pattern.
        y - The height of the pattern.
        rules - String containing the data for the rules.
        titleField - String containing the title metadata.
        authorField - String containing the author metadata.
        dateCheckBox - Checkbox that indicates if data information should be included.
        commentField - String containing the comment metadata.
        splitString - String containing the RLE version of the pattern, split into 70-character lines.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be written to disk.
